Roles & Responsibilities
Aesthetic Doctor

Working day: 5 Days a Week (Offday discuss during interview)
Working Hour: 10am - 7pm
Salary Range: $15,000 - $20,000 (Depends on Experience)
Location: Orchard

Duties:
Provide professional consultation and advice with patients on skin, face, body related aesthetic concern on medical aesthetic treatments.
Perform medical aesthetic procedures such as (but not limited to) lasers and injectables.
Provide medical advice related to the company's products and services.
Maintain high standards of care for patients including consultation, treatment, review patient’s progress and follow up care.

Singapore Medical Council Registered
MBBS, MBChB, MBBCh, MD or equivalent
Certificates of competence for Lasers, Botox, Fillers, Devices for skin tightening
At least 1 year experience in aesthetic medicine

title: Medical Aesthetic Doctor
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Looking for committed and passionate individuals in the medical aesthetic industry with keen interest to work long term.

At The Aesthetic Studio Clinic & Surgery, we believe in a tailored approach in delivering a wide range of safe and effective aesthetic treatments in Singapore. With a team of experienced and caring professionals, we prioritize patient satisfaction and safety above all else. We offer a friendly and inclusive work environment, where every team member's expertise is valued and nurtured.

We are looking for driven and passionate individuals to join our growing team. This position will be responsible for performing non-invasive and minimally-invasive aesthetic procedures in a medical setting. With a focus on providing excellent patient experience, our doctors consult on treatments and provide appropriate skin care products, treatment and recommendations to our patients.

Job Description / Job Responsibilities
Job Highlights:
Competitive salary package with performance-based incentives
Access to state-of-the-art facilities and advanced aesthetic equipment.
Continuous professional development opportunities to expand your expertise including On the Job training by experienced aesthetic medical director with more than 20 years’ experience and Sponsorship for courses and workshops
Collaborative and supportive working environment with experienced medical professionals.
Exposure to a diverse patient base and exciting aesthetic challenges.
Opportunity to make a significant impact in the lives of patients, helping them achieve their aesthetic goal

Job Description:
Perform comprehensive consultations with patients to understand their aesthetic goals and concerns.
Plan and administer a wide range of non-surgical aesthetic treatments, including but not limited to dermal fillers, botulinum toxin injections, laser therapies, chemical peels, and other advanced procedures.
Offer personalized treatment recommendations, ensuring patient safety, satisfaction, and optimal results
Maintain accurate and detailed patient records while adhering to all medical and legal requirements.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements and trends in aesthetic medicine through continuous education and training.
Work hand-in-hand with in-clinic team to provide holistic patient experience and uphold high standards of professional medical expertise towards your work
Participate in team meetings, contribute to clinic growth strategies, and collaborate with internal and externa teams to enhance the overall patient experience achieve clinic’s goals and targets
Contribute to website and media articles.
Contribute to daily operations of the medical clinic.
Job Requirements
Singapore Medical Council (SMC) Full Registration.
Medical Degree recognized by Singapore MOH.
Accumulated COCs for Fractional Photothermolysis for Skin Rejuvenation, Pigment Lasers, Intense Pulsed Light-Skin Rejuvenation and Workshop on Non-Surgical Skin Tightening Devices, Injectibles etc preferred
Strong commitment to patient care, safety and confidentiality
Well-groomed with pleasant personality
Self-driven individual with a positive attitude and Good Interpersonal skills with Team and patients.
Ability to work in a team-oriented environment and maintain a positive and professional attitude
Passionate in wellness and aesthetic medicine and a keen interest in procedural based medicine.
Relevant experience in aesthetics treatment is advantageous

Employee Benefits
Job type: Full time and permanent
Basic Salary Range S$15,000 to S$18,000 + Monthly Individual Sales Commission
5.5 days work week
Sponsorship for courses and workshops

title: Doctor, Remote
company_info: EnviroDynamics Solutions Pte Ltd was establised in 2008 primarily as engineering consultancy provider in which we have a pool of qualified engineers/consultants offering engineering solutions to our cients. In addition, we also provide a range of recruitment and human capital solutions as employment agency to our clients in engineering and technology industries.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Provides patient care via different channels such as clinic, telemedicine, as well as mobile medicine.
Conduct home visits to provide medical and healthcare services including but not limited to consultations and medical procedures.
Perform medical procedures in the home environment as well as the clinic setting.
Perform teleconsultation services under DA Telemedicine Application and TMARS application.
Perform home based Child Developmental Screening (CDS) for home vaccination projects.
Perform home based pre-policy medical examinations for underwriting in medical insurance
Perform doctor-led WICA (Workplace Injury Compensation Act) services to DA’s partnering businesses.
Manage mobile medical services inventory
Provide acute and chronic care for patients of all age groups in the clinic setting
Conduct health screenings and reviews
Maintain timely and accurate documentation of patients’ condition and care given
Provide accurate evaluation and reports
Requirements
Fully Registered Medical Doctor with the Singapore Medical Council (SMC)
Prior experience in clinic and A&E work
Excellent communication skills and Bilingual /Dialects preferred
Able to commit approximately 50 hours per week
Possess high integrity and standards in the work you do
Experience of working within a tech startup and hyper growth environment would be a plus.
Highly collaborative with an entrepreneurial, roll-up-your sleeves attitude, pragmatic, and able to work independently when required
Comfortable with ambiguity
Kindly understand that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
EnviroDynamics Solutions Pte Ltd
Poon Wai Soon, Bernard
Reg. No: R2197713
EA License No.: 12C6285

title: Registrar (Medical Doctor)
company_info: About the NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL The National University Hospital is a tertiary hospital and major referral centre with over 50 medical, surgical and dental specialties, offering a comprehensive suite of specialist care for adults, women and children. It is the only public hospital in Singapore to offer a paediatric kidney and liver transplant programme, in addition to kidney, liver and pancreas transplantation for adults. The Hospital was opened on 24 June 1985 as Singapore’s first restructured hospital. Each year, the Hospital attends to more than one million patients. As an academic health institution, patient safety and good clinical outcomes are the focus of the Hospital. It plays a key role in the training of doctors, nurses, allied health and other healthcare professionals. Translational research is pivotal in the Hospital’s three-pronged focus, and paves the way for new cures and treatment. A member of the National University Health System, it is the principal teaching hospital of the NUS Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine and the NUS Faculty of Dentistry. For more information, visit www.nuh.com.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The National University Health System (NUHS) is an integrated Academic Health System and Regional Health System in Singapore that delivers value-driven, innovative and sustainable healthcare. Institutions in the NUHS group include three hospitals – National University Hospital, Ng Teng Fong General Hospital and Jurong Community Hospital; three National Specialty Centres – National University Cancer Institute, Singapore, National University Heart Centre, Singapore and National University Centre for Oral Health, Singapore; a polyclinic group – the National University Polyclinics; one medical centre – Jurong Medical Centre; and three academic health sciences institutions – National University of Singapore (NUS) Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine (including the Alice Lee Centre for Nursing Studies), NUS Faculty of Dentistry and NUS Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health.

The Departments are seeking candidates who are highly motivated and willing to join us for a challenging and fulfilling appointment as Registrar on a contractual basis.

As a Registrar, you will be part of the care team led by Senior Consultants/Consultants the overall supervision and day-to-day running of the wards, including patient care. In addition, you shall demonstrate good diagnostic and clinical management acumen and perform any other duties as directed by Head of Department or the Chairman Medical Board of the Hospital.
•Be in active clinical practice
•Possess a basic medical degree from an accredited medical university or medical school
•Possess a 3 year of post housemanship clinical experience
•Possess specialty knowledge
•Must be registered with the Singapore Medical Council
•Able to work independently with demonstrated competence in managing patients in the department
•Confident, takes initiatives and a good team player

title: Associate Consultant (Medical Doctor)
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.

Roles & Responsibilities
The National University Health System (NUHS) is an integrated Academic Health System and Regional Health System in Singapore that delivers value-driven, innovative and sustainable healthcare. Institutions in the NUHS group include three hospitals – National University Hospital, Ng Teng Fong General Hospital and Jurong Community Hospital; three National Specialty Centres – National University Cancer Institute, Singapore, National University Heart Centre, Singapore and National University Centre for Oral Health, Singapore; a polyclinic group – the National University Polyclinics; one medical centre – Jurong Medical Centre; and three academic health sciences institutions – National University of Singapore (NUS) Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine (including the Alice Lee Centre for Nursing Studies), NUS Faculty of Dentistry and NUS Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health.

As an Associate Consultant, you will be required to carry out the duties as directed by the Head of Department in accordance with the policies and guidelines set by the Hospital, National University Hospital (NUH) and the Ministry of Health (MOH). You must be able to demonstrate good technical skills (i.e. operative and procedural skills where applicable).
•Possess a basic medical degree and a postgraduate qualifications relevant to the department’s specialty or nature of operations registrable with the Singapore Medical Council
•Be in active clinical practice
•Must be registered with the Singapore Medical Council and must be accredited as Specialists by the Specialist Accreditation Board, Ministry of Health
•Able to work independently with demonstrated competence in managing patients in the department
•Confident, takes initiatives and a good team player

title: Medical Doctors / Medical Director
company_info: A subsidiary of Alliance Healthcare Group, Jaga-Me is a Mobile Medical and Home Care provider. ‘Jaga’ in Malay means ‘to guard’. We hope to move quality healthcare beyond hospital and clinics into the community. Many people prefer to be at home within familiar surroundings during the healing process. By making healthcare as accessible as possible, Jaga-Me aims to empower both patients and doctors/nurses/caregivers in the field to bring healthcare into homes. Together with every team member in the Jaga-Me family, our purpose has continually been to ensure that healthcare would never be out of reach for a person in need. We make real impact, to real people, using innovations and technology, and have been profiled for doing so by the Straits Times* and CNA**. Jaga-Me is supported by NTUC Income, Singtel, raiSE and SPRING Singapore. Find out more at www.jaga-me.com *http://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/health/causes/-week/-2016/-jaga/-me/-helps/-give/-caregivers/-a/-break **http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/singapore/no/-place/-like/-home/-how/-some/-families/-make/-ageing/-at/-home/-work/3329826.html
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a Medical Doctors to provide holistic and patient-centered care for our patients in the home, telemedicine and community setting.

Job Responsibilities:
Assess and identify the needs of patients admitting into Jaga-Me's medical services
Render medical consultations via telemedicine and house calls
Assist with triaging patients, and regular reviews of patients’ status
Collaborate closely with our Chief Medical Officer, operations and nursing teams to facilitate patients' access to appropriate care, as well as to ensure smooth and safe operations
Job Requirements:
Possess medical qualification recognized by the Singapore Medical Council (SMC)
Maintained CME requirements and in good standing with SMC
At least 2 years of medical practice in the hospital or community
At least one year of work experience in acute care
5-day rostered work week
Candidates with relevant home medical/geriatric/palliative cae experience and who is keen with medical administration/management may be considered for Medical Director role

title: Medical Doctor
company_info: Speedoc was founded in 2017 in Singapore with a mission to bring advanced medical care to home. With the ageing population to address and improved access to technology, Speedoc built a complete end-to-end system for doctors and patients, so that house call doctor services can be provided with ease to people in the community. With Speedoc's emphasis on cost-effectiveness and modern medical devices, home medical services need not be limited to only immobile or bedbound patients but to everyday people who may require GP or urgent-care services.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Who are we?
With a vision of making an impact on Asia’s healthcare landscape, by making healthcare more convenient, accessible and affordable to all, Speedoc seeks to provide a full suite of tech-enabled healthcare services on demand including doctors, nurses, allied care professionals, ambulances and medication delivery. By centralising services, current urgent and medical-care are built on outdated access and communication models. Providers lose the fundamental aspect of health: to reduce total impact to the Patient. With the ageing population to address and improved access to technology, Speedoc built a complete end-to-end system for doctors and patients, so that house call doctor services can be provided with ease to people in the community. With Speedoc's emphasis on cost-effectiveness and modern medical devices, home medical services need not be limited to only immobile or bed bound patients but to everyday people who may require GP or urgent-care services.

Who are we looking for?
We are looking for a Medical Doctor. Reporting to the Medical Director, you will be providing medical care, including diagnosis, counselling, treatment, monitoring, transport, and appropriate referrals for patients requesting Speedoc Mobile Medicine services

Responsibilities
The responsibilities include but not limited to the following:
Diagnosis & treatment of medical / surgical conditions, including urgent conditions, while on duty.
Counsels patient, or individuals designated by patient on the patient’s conditions on conditions, procedures and treatment, and relevant alternatives for both.
Observation and follow-up of patient after treatment; appropriate specialist referrals
Dealing with patients feedback with regards to clinical service, and coordinate service recovery efforts where appropriate
Provides training & guidance of onboarding medical colleagues where necessary
Complying with all organizational & departmental policies and procedures including patient safety parameters

Job Requirements
Basic Medical Degree recognized by Singapore Medical Council (SMC)
Full registration with SMC is a must
Current Basic Cardiac Life Support with AED Certification is compulsory
Current medical malpractice insurance is a must
Advance Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) Certification is preferred
At least 3 years working experience with relevant clinical exposure preferred
Post graduate training in relevant fields, while preferred, is not required
